result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Antonio Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay related DNA surcharge and
pay Court costs and surcharges by 10-27-16.
Failure to pay is civil judgment.  
Restitution set at $0.   
No driver's license suspension.

***ORDER, dated December 1, 2014/Judge Watts/ GRANTS DEFENDANT'S REQUEST FOR RELEASE TIME FOR CHURCH....***
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with huber for work, child care & treatment.  STAYED to 11-10-14 by noon.

As a convicted felon, defendant may no longer use or possess any firearms.
Defendant may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment  pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.195 is GRANTED.   Defendant may be released for Church.  Order filed and signed.  
cc: file, defendant, and state.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for church release.

Defendant Michael Antonio Howard in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 15 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, child care and treatment. STAYED to 11/10/2014 by noon.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 10/27/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 10/27/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Michael Antonio Howard in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Purusant to plea negotiations, Court ordered COunt 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 9/30/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
